intro: Cinnamodendron axillare, commonly known as the axillary cinnamodendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes various species of trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
